Description: Terracotta model dagger. A model sword, the scabbard lost, with a ribbed handle and quadruple-balled pommel, the guard of curved shape enclosing a raised stud. The blade has been pared. Summary treatment at the back, with two incuse lozenges within the guard. Probably hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous brown Nile silt, covered, front and back, with a white dressing; red paint on the balls of the pommel and on the stud on the guard.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparanda. See perhaps two sword-hilts, apparently with quadruple-balled pommels, from Bubastis: Schürmann 1989: nos 1255 and 1256, dated Roman period (?) Perdrizet 1921: no. 112, from Lower Egypt, has a similar hilt and guard shape, but the pommel is different.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3290)
